skill.name: Fundamentals Gate
skill.description: Verify code quality standards are met - naming, structure, DRY principles. Issues result in SUGGESTIONS for improvement.
skill.summary: Verify code quality standards are met - naming, structure, DRY principles. Issues result in SUGGESTI...
skill.author: DanielPodolsky

security_audit.summary: Pure markdown prompt-based skill containing only documentation and review guidelines. No executable code, no network access, no file system modifications, no command execution. Safe for publication.

content.value_statement: Code reviews often miss basic quality issues like unclear naming and oversized functions. This gate provides a systematic checklist to catch fundamentals and offer actionable suggestions for improvement.
actual_capabilities: Check naming clarity and consistency across code
Evaluate function size and single responsibility
Flag magic numbers and unclear constants
limitations: Does not execute or test code
Only provides suggestions, never blocks progress
Requires manual code context from user
Does not integrate with CI/CD pipelines

use_cases.title: Learn coding standards
use_cases.description: Help new team members understand and apply coding conventions through guided feedback

use_cases.title: Standardize reviews
use_cases.description: Add consistent fundamentals checks to any code review workflow

use_cases.title: Identify growth areas
use_cases.description: Receive specific, actionable feedback on code quality fundamentals

prompt_templates.title: Run full gate
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the Fundamentals Gate on this code. Check naming, function focus, structure, and duplication.

prompt_templates.title: Check naming
prompt_templates.prompt: Check the naming in this code. Are variables descriptive? Are functions verb-led? Any unclear names?

prompt_templates.title: Review functions
prompt_templates.prompt: Review these functions for single responsibility and size. Any god functions? Too many parameters?

prompt_templates.title: Find duplication
prompt_templates.prompt: Look for code duplication in this code. Any patterns that should be extracted into shared functions?

output_examples.input: Run Fundamentals Gate on my code
output: Suggestion 2: 'processOrder' is 80 lines. Consider splitting into validateOrder, calculateTotal, saveOrder
Suggestion 3: Replace 'if (status === 2)' with a named constant like STATUS.ACTIVE
These are suggestions, not blockers. The code works ‚Äî this is polish.

best_practices: Use during code reviews before deeper architectural analysis
Combine with other gates for comprehensive review coverage
Apply suggestions selectively based on project context and timeline
anti_patterns: Blocking merges on minor naming suggestions
Ignoring all suggestions and skipping fundamentals entirely
Using gate for production code that only needs prototype-level polish

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. No tool configuration required.

faq.question: What code languages does this cover?
faq.answer: Language-agnostic. Fundamentals apply to any programming language.

faq.question: Does this slow down my workflow?
faq.answer: Runs on demand during code review. No background processes or persistent overhead.

faq.question: Is my code sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. All analysis happens within your AI session. No external servers or storage.

faq.question: Why are these only suggestions?
faq.answer: Fundamentals are polish, not correctness. Blocking on style slows delivery. Suggestions allow learning without blocking.

faq.question: How is this different from linters?
faq.answer: Linters catch syntax and style. This gate catches higher-level issues like function focus and duplication.
